text:
It's kind of mind blowing that the human body can just survive in zero-gravity

Like our systems can just adapt to that. Insane.

I never mind having nightmares/dreams about loss

If anything, it's a relief to have them. When I wake up I feel gratitude for the things I have

That is to say, I might even voluntarily choose to have nightmares for the sake of my own benefit

Two comments on this

1) in Vedantic tradition where approximately life : sleeping :: moksa : waking up, this forms a natural answer as to why a soul might volunteer to "go back to sleep", e.g., choose to live on earth (where there is dukha, suffering).

2) "there is no such thing as a bad trip" is a controversial phrase within the psychedelic community, but it is often justified in a similar way. That going through a nightmarish-anxious trip will leave you better (or even, was necessary for your development)
This is why mathematicians can be wordcels and shape rotators
Good poll I feel quite represented with the answer selections
